title: 5th Annual Clean Up Commerce Day assembling volunteers for civic pride
text:
5th Annual Clean Up Commerce Day assembling volunteers for civic pride Use your key for the next article Some of the 200 volunteers who took to the streets of Commerce in 2014 Citadel Outlets 
Volunteering to Clean Up 
The owner of the Citadel Outlet Mall in the City of Commerce will be one of about 200 volunteers cleaning up several streets this Saturday, August 8 in the City of Commerce. Steve Craig worked with city officials and other business leaders to organize the event in 2011. Boys and girls from elementary school age to their teens will be involved and Steve sees it was a way to instill civic pride. 
Nonprofit organizations are involved as well and Steve donates $100 for each volunteer the organization has in attendance. In 2014, he donated over $100,000. 
The Fifth Annual Clean Up Commerce Day begins with sunrise at 6 a.m. and runs until 1 p.m. Streets that will get attention this year are portions of: 
· Telegraph Road 
· Corvette Street 
Carrying on the Heritage 
Commerce was incorporated as a city in 1959 by, as the city's web site states, "a hardy band of residents and business leaders …. These volunteers proclaimed their intention to establish a model city with unique advantages for industry and residents alike." 
Manufacturing was once the most important sector for the city but the region changed over the decades and many buildings and streets fell into disrepair. Commerce runs along the I-5 and the city's identity has been overshadowed by Los Angeles. 
The Citadel Outlet Mall is the most visible landmark thanks in part to the wall resembling an Assyrian fortress running parallel to the freeway. Steve Craig's company, Craig Realty Group, took ownership of the mall in 2002 and began to upgrade the property without the use of public funds. 
The collection of stores is a major employer in the area providing over 2,000 jobs and a significant revenue source for the city. In the recent fiscal year, the Citadel provided about $10 million in sales tax revenue. 
"That's pretty strong for a city with a budget of $55 million," Steve told me during an interview in 2014. 
Youth volunteers are being organized through the city's sports coordinator Frank Garcia via email at Frank@ci.commerce.ca.us . 
Donations from local businesses and adults interested in volunteering should contact Traci Markel, marketing director via email at Traci@citadeloutlets.com . Suggested Links
